discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I'm not going with B simply because it's not listed on the exam objectives. I'm not choosing E because there are a lot of extra steps involved when cloning a VM in a production environment.

questions.question_text: A systems administrator is provisioning a large number of virtual Linux machines that will be configured identically. The administrator would like to configure the machines quickly and easily but does not have access to an automation/orchestration platform. Additionally, the administrator would like to set up a system that can be used in the future, even on newer versions of the OS. Which of the following will best meet the administrator's requirements?

choices.E: Configuring a single server and then creating clones of it
choices.A: Deploying each server from a VM template
choices.D: Copying/pasting configuration commands into each server through SSH sessions
choices.B: Using a kickstart file during installation
choices.C: Configuring each server manually one at a time

discussion.content: The WinSCP tool is commonly used to transfer files between Linux and Windows systems. WinSCP has an easy GUI and encrypts the contents of the file transfer.

Selected Answer: D
SCP
Linux also relies on scp to provide encrypted file transfers using SSH. The Linux command to copy a file is cp. Therefore, scp is secure copy. It uses the same encryption mechanism as SSH to guarantee file integrity and confidentiality.

If there is WinSCP available, WinSCP is the best answer.
The WinSCP tool is commonly used to transfer files between Linux and Windows systems. WinSCP has an easy GUI and encrypts the contents of the file transfer.

Ref. The Official CompTIA Server+ Study Guide (Exam SK0-005) page 198.

Selected Answer: D
Xcopy and Robocopy are two Windows built-in command line file copy utilities. Both of them can help you copy files and folders from one location to another.

comments.content: Also, robocopy & xcopy are windows os only commands for windows machines, telnet is irrelevant

questions.question_text: Which of the following should an administrator use to transfer log files from a Linux server to a Windows workstation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Warm sites offer a balance between cost-effectiveness and quick deployment, making them suitable for a startup's initial disaster recovery needs. They provide more resources than cold sites but are less expensive than hot sites, offering a good compromise for small to medium-sized businesses with limited budgets

questions.question_text: A startup company needs to set up an initial disaster recovery site. The site must be cost-effective and deployed quickly. Which of the following sites should the company set up?

Users in an office lost access to a file server following a short power outage. The server administrator noticed the server was powered off. Which of the following should the administrator do to prevent this situation in the future?

choices.C: Connect the server to a redundant network
choices.D: Connect the server to a UPS
choices.A: Connect the server to a KVM

questions.question_text: A technician is migrating a Type 1 hypervisor to new hardware and needs to complete the process with as little disruption as possible. Which of the following is most appropriate for the technician to consider?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
While processor (B), motherboard (C), and size (D) are important considerations, ensuring that the hard drives are properly addressed is critical for a successful migration with minimal disruption. The hard drives directly affect how VMs are stored and accessed, making them a priority in this process
